data.title: Climate Russia: Average Temperature, Weather by Month & Weather for Russia
data.meta_description: You will find here a summary of the top locations in Russia with Climate Graphs, weather by month and weather forecast for the next 14 days.
data.text:
Climate Moscow: Weather by Month

Max. Temperature °C (°F) Avg. Temperature °C (°F) Min. Temperature °C (°F) Precipitation / Rainfall mm (in) Humidity Rainy days

January February March April May June July August September October November December

Climate Graph & Average Temperature Moscow

The climate is cold and temperate. There is significant rainfall throughout the year in Moscow. Even the driest month still has a lot of rainfall. This location is classified as Dfb by Köppen and Geiger. In Moscow, the average annual temperature is 4.9 °C. The rainfall here averages 679 mm.

Climate Saint Petersburg: Weather by Month

Max. Temperature °C (°F) Avg. Temperature °C (°F) Min. Temperature °C (°F) Precipitation / Rainfall mm (in) Humidity Rainy days

January February March April May June July August September October November December

Climate Graph & Average Temperature Saint Petersburg

The climate is cold and temperate. Saint Petersburg has a significant amount of rainfall during the year. This is true even for the driest month. This location is classified as Dfb by Köppen and Geiger. The temperature here averages 4.9 °C. Precipitation here averages 636 mm.

Climate Baikal: Weather by Month

Max. Temperature °C (°F) Avg. Temperature °C (°F) Min. Temperature °C (°F) Precipitation / Rainfall mm (in) Humidity Rainy days

January February March April May June July August September October November December

Climate Graph & Average Temperature Baikal

The climate is cold and temperate. In winter, there is much less rainfall in Baikal than in summer. The climate here is classified as Dwb by the Köppen-Geiger system. The average annual temperature is 0.1 °C in Baikal. Precipitation here averages 512 mm.

Climate Kazan: Weather by Month

Max. Temperature °C (°F) Avg. Temperature °C (°F) Min. Temperature °C (°F) Precipitation / Rainfall mm (in) Humidity Rainy days

January February March April May June July August September October November December

Climate Graph & Average Temperature Kazan

The climate is cold and temperate. The is a great deal of rainfall in Kazan, even in the driest month. This climate is considered to be Dfb according to the Köppen-Geiger climate classification. The average temperature in Kazan is 3.8 °C. In a year, the average rainfall is 533 mm.

Climate Graph & Average Temperature Yekaterinburg

The climate is cold and temperate. Yekaterinburg is a city with a significant rainfall. Even in the driest month there is a lot of rain. This climate is considered to be Dfb according to the Köppen-Geiger climate classification. The average annual temperature in Yekaterinburg is 2.7 °C. About 497 mm of precipitation falls annually.

Climate Graph & Average Temperature Sochi

The climate is warm and temperate in Sochi. Sochi is a city with a significant rainfall. Even in the driest month there is a lot of rain. The Köppen-Geiger climate classification is Cfa. In Sochi, the average annual temperature is 14.5 °C. Precipitation here averages 1514 mm.
